target.words: abbreviation -- (a shortened form of a word or phrase)
acronym -- (a word formed from the initial letters of the several words in the name)
meaning, significance, signification, import -- (the message that is intended or expressed or signified)
meaning, substance -- (the idea that is intended)
definition -- (a concise explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase or symbol)
define -- (give a definition for the meaning of a word)
origin -- (the source of something's existence or from which it derives or is derived)
difference -- (the quality of being unlike or dissimilar)
describe, depict, draw -- (give a description of)
reason, ground -- (a rational motive for a belief or action)
cause -- (events that provide the generative force that is the origin of something)
animal, animate_being, beast, brute, creature, fauna -- (a living organism characterized by voluntary movement)
animal_group -- (a group of animals)
body_part -- (any part of an organism such as an organ or extremity)
color, colour, coloring, colouring -- (a visual attribute of things that results from the light they emit or transmit or reflect)
show -- (a social event involving a public performance or entertainment)
music -- (an artistic form of auditory communication incorporating instrumental or vocal tones in a structured and continuous manner)
book -- (a written work or composition that has been published (printed on pages bound together))
writing, written_material, piece_of_writing -- (the work of a writer; anything expressed in letters of the alphabet (especially when considered from the point of view of style and effect))
classic -- (a creation of the highest excellence)
art, fine_art -- (the products of human creativity; works of art collectively)
medium -- (a means or instrumentality for storing or communicating information)
trilogy -- (a set of three literary or dramatic works related in subject or theme)
sequel, continuation -- (a part added to a book or play that continues and extends it)
currency -- (the metal or paper medium of exchange that is presently used)
symptom -- ((medicine) any sensation or change in bodily function that is experienced by a patient and is associated with a particular disease)
drug -- (a substance that is used as a medicine or narcotic)
medical_care, medical_aid -- (professional treatment for illness or injury)
physical_condition, physiological_state, physiological_condition -- (the condition or state of the body or bodily functions)
event -- (something that happens at a given place and time)
meeting, group_meeting -- (a formally arranged gathering)
food, nutrient -- (any substance that can be metabolized by an animal to give energy and build tissue)
food, solid_food -- (any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment)
fruit -- (the ripened reproductive body of a seed plant)
helping, portion, serving -- (an individual quantity of food or drink taken as part of a meal)
musical_instrument, instrument -- (any of various devices or contrivances that can be used to produce musical tones or sounds)
language, linguistic_communication -- (a systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds or conventional symbols)
dialect, idiom, accent -- (the usage or vocabulary that is characteristic of a specific group of people)
letter, letter_of_the_alphabet, alphabetic_character -- (the conventional characters of the alphabet used to represent speech)
character_set -- (an ordered list of characters that are used together in writing or printing)
plant, flora, plant_life -- ((botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion)
vegetation, flora, botany -- (all the plant life in a particular region or period)
trade_name, brand_name, brand, marque -- (a name given to a product or service)
merchandise, ware, product -- (commodities offered for sale)
religion, faith, religious_belief -- (a strong belief in a supernatural power or powers that control human destiny)
cult -- (followers of an exclusive system of religious beliefs and practices)
ult, cultus, religious_cult -- (a system of religious beliefs and rituals)
sport, athletics -- (an active diversion requiring physical exertion and competition)
game -- (a contest with rules to determine a winner)
game -- (an amusement or pastime)
exercise, exercising, physical_exercise, physical_exertion, workout -- (the activity of exerting your muscles in various ways to keep fit)
substance -- (the real physical matter of which a person or thing consists)
symbol -- (an arbitrary sign (written or printed) that has acquired a conventional significance)
technique -- (a practical method or art applied to some particular task)
approach, attack, plan_of_attack -- (ideas or actions intended to deal with a problem or situation)
manner, mode, style, way, fashion -- (how something is done or how it happens)
method -- (a way of doing something, especially a systematic way)
procedure, process -- (a particular course of action intended to achieve a result)
plan_of_action -- (a plan for actively doing something)
term -- (a word or expression used for some particular thing)
vehicle -- (a conveyance that transports people or objects)
word -- (a unit of language that native speakers can identify)
organization, organisation -- (a group of people who work together)
group, grouping -- (any number of entities (members) considered as a unit)
gang, pack, ring, mob -- (an association of criminals)
person, individual, someone, somebody, mortal, soul -- (a human being)
homo, man, human_being, human -- (any living or extinct member of the family Hominidae characterized by superior intelligence, articulate speech, and erect carriage)
name -- (a language unit by which a person or thing is known)
spiritual_being, supernatural_being -- (an incorporeal being believed to have powers to affect the course of human events)
spirit -- (the vital principle or animating force within living things)
profession -- (the body of people in a learned occupation)
title, title_of_respect, form_of_address -- (an identifying appellation signifying status or function: e.g. `Mr.' or `General')
occupation, business, job, line_of_work, line -- (the principal activity in your life that you do to earn money)
urban_area, populated_area -- (a geographical area constituting a city or town)
state, nation, country, land, commonwealth, res_publica, body_politic -- (a politically organized body of people under a single government)
country, state, land -- (the territory occupied by a nation)
mountain, mount -- (a land mass that projects well above its surroundings)
vent, volcano -- (a fissure in the earth's crust (or in the surface of some other planet) through which molten lava and gases erupt)
range, mountain_range, range_of_mountains, chain, mountain_chain, chain_of_mountains -- (a series of hills or mountains)
state, province -- (the territory occupied by one of the constituent administrative districts of a nation)
location -- (a point or extent in space)
land, dry_land, earth, ground, solid_ground, terra_firma -- (the solid part of the earth's surface)
body_of_water, water -- (the part of the earth's surface covered with water (such as a river or lake or ocean)
celestial_body, heavenly_body -- (natural objects visible in the sky)
desert -- (arid land with little or no vegetation)
phone_number, telephone_number, number -- (the number is used in calling a particular telephone)
code -- (a coding system used for transmitting messages requiring brevity or secrecy)
number -- (a concept of quantity derived from zero and units)
day, twenty-four_hours, twenty-four_hour_period, 24-hour_interval, solar_day, mean_solar_day)
date, day_of_the_month -- (the specified day of the month)
year, twelvemonth, yr - (a period of time containing 365 (or 366) days
calendar_month, month - (one of the twelve divisions of the calendar year)
distance -- (the property created by the space between two objects or points)
stature, height -- ((of a standing person) the distance from head to foot)
dimension -- (the magnitude of something in a particular direction (especially length or width or height))
linear_unit, linear_measure -- (a unit of measurement of length)
distance, length -- (size of the gap between two places)
depth, deepness -- (the extent downward or backward or inward)
outgo, spending, expenditure, outlay -- (money paid out; an amount spent)
money -- (the most common medium of exchange; functions as legal tender)
monetary_value, price, cost -- (the property of having material worth (often indicated by the amount of money something would bring if sold))
price, terms, damage -- (the amount of money needed to purchase something)
sum, sum_of_money, amount, amount_of_money -- (a quantity of money)
monetary_unit -- (a unit of money)
measure, quantity, amount -- (how much there is or how many there are of something that you can quantify)
magnitude_relation, quantitative_relation -- (a relation between magnitudes)
probability -- (the quality of being probable)
probability, chance -- (a measure of how likely it is that some event will occur)
time_period, period_of_time, period -- (an amount of time)
time_unit, unit_of_time -- (a unit for measuring time periods)
age -- (how long something has existed)
time, clip -- (an instance or single occasion for some event)
life_expectancy -- (an expected time to live as calculated on the basis of statistical probabilities)
speed, velocity -- (distance travelled per unit time)
speed, swiftness, fastness -- (a rate (usually rapid) at which something happens)
temperature -- (the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment (corresponding to its molecular activity))
temperature_unit -- (a unit of measurement for temperature)
size -- (the physical magnitude of something (how big it is))
volume -- (the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object)
area, expanse, surface_area -- (the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary)
area_unit, square_measure -- (a system of units used to measure areas)
volume_unit, capacity_unit, capacity_measure, cubage_unit, cubic_measure, cubic_content_unit, displacement_unit, cubature_unit -- (a unit of measurement of volume or capacity)
weight -- (the vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity)
mass_unit -- (a unit of measurement for mass)
weight_unit, weight -- (a unit used to measure weight)
mass -- (the property of a body that causes it to have weight in a gravitational field)
weigh -- (have a certain weight)
